artist: Artist: Attributed to Andrea Boscoli; Artist: after Polidoro da Caravaggio
description: processing figures, moving toward right; figure third from left holds a shallow bowl in his PR hand; second figure from right in foreground has PR arm outstretched; man at right edge has long beard
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [Borcoli, after / Polidoro]; on back, in blue ink: [(illegible) / 1977]; on back, in brown pencil: [K1099]
markings: LLC, stamped in blue: [CW (?--monogram)]; LRC, stamped in red: [CARLO / PAYER (?)]
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash on laid paper
provenance: Giuseppe Vallardi, Lugt 1223 (1784-1863), Milan. Carlo Prayer, Lugt 2044 (1826-1900), Milan. Juan (d. 1920) and Felix (d. 1914) Bernasconi, Milan, Lugano, and Argentina; by descent to Maria Bernasconi (in 1977); Bernasconi sale, Christie's, London, July 5, 1988, no. 194 as Circle of Ambrogio Figino, after Polidoro, for Â£280, Moir); Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1988-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Procession
